alert.note: Alert for Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Union County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 3:37PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN UNION COUNTY THROUGH 415 PM MDT... At 337 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southwest of Kenton to 7 miles southeast of Des Moines. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Clayton, Des Moines, Grenville, Clayton Lake State Park, Seneca, Mount Dora and Moses. This includes Highway 64 between Mile Markers 381 and 429. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for northeastern New Mexico.

area.areaDesc: Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Union County
